author: nonameispossible

text:
I see the faults, definitely. I make comparisons, and weigh every pro and con, within the series.

You make an excellent point, but the key word I used, was "respect", not "ogle". 

A lot of people shut down Wind Waker, and for all the wrong reasons (i.e. 'deeerrp where's Hyrule' and 'hurr durr the animation sucks'), and those people are not worth this retort, because they can't RESPECT the game. 
There are WAY better LoZ's to date, but not seeing the flaws is, indeed, foolish.
author: DickWad16

text: I think if you're smart enough to see faults in a series even if it's a series you really love makes you more of a fan. Blindly liking every installment just makes you a fool. If Zelda isn't a good example for you then think about Sonic for a second. Does one really need to like every Sonic game to be a Sonic fan?

text: @20114D I didnt like SS as much as TP when I started playing it, truth be told. However after playing for about 10-15 hours it really grew on me and I realised how good it was, how well the game was designed and just how different it was while still being Zelda. It was shown much love for a 25th anniversary, not all games get that. Fi was cool, something different and more subdued after Midna's badass in your face attitude.
author: J.M

text: @20114D I actually think TP is still probably the best narrative, but I do have to admit SS has taken the lead for me. That game is a piece of architecture.
